<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Bright Lion Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2172) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City](/Sources.aspx?ID=102) pg. 79, [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 101</row>

**Archetype** [Bright Lion](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=129)

**Prerequisites**
member of the Bright Lions; not a worshipper of [Walkena](/Deities.aspx?ID=159); Trained in [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15)

**Access**
 Bright Lion  background

</column>

---

You become trained in your choice of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) and in [Mzali Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8); if you were already trained, you become an expert instead. You incorporate enough worship of Walkena in your daily life to avoid suspicion. You typically don't need to [Lie](/Actions.aspx?ID=47) or [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) to pass yourself off as a worshipper of [Walkena](/Deities.aspx?ID=159). Against careful inspection, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to Deception checks specifically to pass yourself off as a version of yourself faithful to Walkena.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Bright Lion archetype.

<title level="2">Bright Lion Dedication leads to...</title>
[Blessing of the Sun Gods](/Feats.aspx?ID=3410), [Elude the Divine](/Feats.aspx?ID=2176), [Lion's Might](/Feats.aspx?ID=3411), [Sun's Fury](/Feats.aspx?ID=2174), [Warding Light](/Feats.aspx?ID=2173)
